 To apply for admission into the St Mary’s Marianhill Nursing School SMMNS Application Form 2024, kindly follow the link and apply online. All applications must be submitted online

What to Know About the St Mary’s Marianhill Nursing School Application Form Portal

The St Mary’s Marianhill Nursing School SMMNS Application portal is designed to accept applications of candidates seeking admission into the University. In the portal, applicants can Purchase application forms, Track and monitor application status, pay fees, Print acknowledgment slips, check the admission list, etc.

St Mary’s Marianhill Nursing School is located in Marianhill, a suburb of Durban in KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa. The school offers nursing education and training programs that prepare students for a career in the healthcare industry.

Some of the programs offered at St Mary’s Marianhill Nursing School include:

  • Diploma in Nursing: This program is a three-year course that trains students to become registered nurses.
  • Diploma in Midwifery: This program is a one-year course that trains students to become midwives.
  • Bridging Course: This course is designed for enrolled nurses who want to upgrade their qualifications to become registered nurses.

The admission requirements for these programs may vary, but in general, students must have completed high school or an equivalent qualification, meet the minimum academic requirements, and pass an entrance exam.

To apply to St Mary’s Marianhill Nursing School, visit their website or contact their admissions office for more information on the application process and requirements.

Who is Eligible to Apply for Admission

To be eligible to apply to St Mary’s Marianhill Nursing School, applicants need to meet certain requirements, which may include:

  1. Be a South African citizen or have a valid study permit
  2. Have a minimum of a Grade 12 certificate or an equivalent qualification
  3. Have a minimum of 50% in the following subjects: English, Life Sciences, and either Mathematics or Physical Science
  4. Have a good command of English, both written and spoken
  5. Be medically fit to undertake nursing training
  6. Have no criminal record
  7. Grade 12 certificate applicants are of added advantage
  8. Must write the NBTs for admission to SMMNS on/before 15 October 2024.
  9. FPS of 480 or above.
  10. NBT scores of Upper
  11. Intermediate for AL & QL
  12. Mathematics 60%
  13. English HL 50%
  14. English FAL 60%

For the Bridging Course, applicants must be enrolled nurses with an Enrolled Nursing certificate and at least two years of work experience.

It’s important to note that meeting the minimum requirements does not guarantee admission, as admission is competitive and based on merit. Applicants may be required to undergo an entrance exam and an interview as part of the selection process.

For specific information on eligibility and admission requirements for St Mary’s Marianhill Nursing School, contacting their admissions office is recommended.

How to Apply | SMMNS Application Form 2024

Eligible candidates can click here to apply.

Follow the steps below

  • Visit Application portal
  • Choose the type of Application (Undergraduate, Post Graduate, Semester Studies)
  • Fill and complete all necessary pages
  • Pay Application fees where required

Related: SMMNS Application Form 2024 | St Mary’s Marianhill Nursing School

St Mary’s Marianhill Nursing School Application Required Documents

St Mary’s Marianhill Nursing School requirement for application
The requirements for applying to St Mary’s Marianhill Nursing School may vary depending on the program you are interested in, but in general, you will need to provide the following:
  1. Completed application form: You must fill out an application form, which may be available on the school’s website or can be obtained from their admissions office.
  2. Certified copy of your ID: You must provide a certified copy of your South African ID document or passport.
  3. Certified copy of your matric certificate: You must provide a certified copy or an equivalent qualification.
  4. Academic transcripts: You may need to provide academic transcripts from previous academic institutions you have attended.
  5. Proof of payment: You must provide proof of payment of the application fee.
  6. Personal statement: You may need to write a personal statement or essay outlining your interest in nursing and career goals.
  7. Letters of recommendation: You may need to provide letters of recommendation from previous teachers, employers, or other professionals who can attest to your character and abilities.
  8. Medical clearance certificate: You may need to provide a medical clearance certificate indicating that you are medically fit to undertake nursing training.

It’s important to note that the application requirements may vary depending on the program and the intake date. It’s recommended to contact the school’s admissions office directly for specific information on the application requirements for the program you are interested in.

Closing Date

July 31, 2024

SOUTH AFRICAN NURSING COUNCIL: NOMINATION FORM 2024

You can visit the SANC website at www.sanc.co.za and navigate to the “Downloads” section. Look for the “Forms” tab and click on it. Here, you should be able to find the SANC nomination form for 2024.

If you cannot find the form on the website, contact the SANC directly. You can call them at +27 12 420 1000 or email them to registrar@sanc.co.za.

Once you have obtained the nomination form, read and follow the instructions carefully. Provide all the required information and documentation, and ensure your nomination is timely.

For more information regarding the application for admission into the St Mary’s Marianhill Nursing School, kindly drop your messages in the comment box below.

Questions Asked About the SANC Application Form

Q: What is the SANC?

A: The SANC is a statutory body that regulates the nursing profession in South Africa. It is responsible for registering nurses and midwives, accreditation of nursing education institutions, and enforcing ethical and professional standards in the nursing profession.

Q: Who needs to apply to the SANC?

A: Anyone who wants to practice as a nurse or midwife in South Africa must apply for registration with the SANC. This includes both South African citizens and foreign nationals.

Q: What are the requirements for SANC registration?

A: The requirements for SANC registration vary depending on the registration category. Generally, applicants must have completed a nursing education program recognized by the SANC, passed the required SANC exams, and met the SANC’s requirements for character and fitness.

Q: How do I apply for SANC registration?

A: To apply for SANC registration, you must complete the appropriate application form, which can be downloaded from the SANC website. You must also submit the required supporting documentation, such as certified copies of your ID or passport, nursing qualifications, and proof of payment of the application fee.

Q: How long does it take to process an SANC application?

A: The processing time for an SANC application can vary depending on a range of factors, including the completeness of the application and the volume of applications being processed at the time. It is advisable to submit your application well before you need to practice as a nurse or midwife.

Q: How can I check the status of my SANC application?

A: You can check the status of your SANC application by contacting the SANC directly. They can provide you with information on the progress of your application and any additional documentation or information that may be required.
